translation.en: [man over megaphone] Mr. Miller?
Is everyone okay in there?
Agent Ford, FBI.
Here, sir.
[man over megaphone] We want to know what's going on.
If you harm anyone, it will not end well for you!
Special Agent Holden Ford.
-Ninkovich. -Is he talking?
Not making sense. Been briefed?
On the way over. Five people still in there?
A security guard, the secretary, three guys from the line.
-[Miller] Where is she? -[Ninkovich] Take it easy, Mr. Miller.
[Miller] I want my wife!
Put the gun down, step away from Ms. Curtwell.
-[Miller] I have asked you-- -We need to see that everyone is unharmed.
translation.ko: 내가 말했잖아! 모두 무사한지 알아야 합니다

translation.en: You gonna shoot me?
If you do not abide by our terms, and soon--
You can't see me!
I'm warning you, our patience is wearing thin.
How can you shoot what you can't see?
Mr. Miller!
-No, thank you. -[feedback squeals]
Hey, Cody.
My name is Holden. I'd like to help you.
-Tell me what's going on. -I gotta talk to my wife.
-[Holden] All right. -She's the only one.
I understand.
For the moment, is there anything else we can get you?
Get these fucking people away.
translation.ko: 이 썩을 놈들 다 가라고 해!

translation.en: Okay.
-Okay... -[camera shutters clicking]
If I can get them to back off,
will you... relax with Ms. Curtwell?
Give us some time to reach your wife.
[Miller] Okay.
Thank you.
Keep the snipers. Back out the perimeter.
If he starts firing, we'll have to storm the place.
translation.ko: 놈이 총질 시작하면 밀고 들어가야 하는데

translation.en: They're making me nervous. Imagine what they're doing to him.
He has no criminal history. He's clearly having an episode.
We need to keep him calm and wear him down.
Get rid of those reporters.
All right, guys. Back it up!
-[man] All right. Let's go. Back it up. -[man 2] Move back.
How am I doing?
-[Miller] You see me? -Oh, God.
Yes, I can see you!
-What do you see? -[Holden] I can see that you're naked.
I can see that you're cold.
Is there a phone? Can we get him on the line?
translation.ko: 안에 전화 있어요? 연결할 수 있습니까?

translation.en: -He's got it off the hook. -That was his demand, talk to his wife?
Took all day to find her. She's on her way.
-You're not bringing her. -I want her to calm him.
Her presence might have the opposite effect.
Hi, Mrs. Miller? Don't get out.
I'm Holden Ford from the FBI. Do you understand the situation?
translation.ko: FBI의 홀든 포드입니다 어떤 상황인지 아세요?

translation.en: -Cody's got some people in there? -What happened this morning?
translation.ko: - 코디가 인질을 잡았어요? - 아침에 무슨 일이 있었죠?

translation.en: I don't know.
I tried to get him sectioned on Sunday, but I haven't seen him since.
translation.ko: 일요일에 정신과 입원시키려고 본 게 마지막이에요

translation.en: They told me he stole a shotgun, robbed a liquor store?
Was he delusional? Violent?
He's not violent.
He's been saying that he's invisible for a while now.
translation.ko: 얼마 전부터 자기는 사람들 눈에 안 보인다면서

translation.en: Truly invisible. He's been seeing a doctor.
translation.ko: 완전히 안 보인다고 병원 다니고 있었어요

translation.en: Did the doctor diagnose him?
Cody wouldn't tell me.
He's taking medication, but he might've stopped.
translation.ko: 약을 먹어야 하는데 안 먹었나 봐요

translation.en: -What kind of medication? -I'm not sure.
Here's his doctor.
You tried to get him sectioned?
He kept talking to people that weren't there, saying they could see him.
translation.ko: 자꾸 누가 자길 본다면서 허공에 말을 하잖아요

translation.en: I told him I was gonna leave him if he didn't go to the hospital.
translation.ko: 병원에 안 가면 전 집 나간다고 했어요

translation.en: -You gave him an ultimatum? -[Mrs. Miller sobbing] I'm sorry.
-I feel awful. -This is not your fault.
Has he hurt anyone?
Not that we know about. I'm sending you along for now.
Have someone call his doctor.
Get his wife to tell him she won't leave him.
We need more information. Let's see if we can get him on the line.
Cody!
Everything okay in there?
I'd really like to know what's going on in there.
I promise you, we can work this out.
Where's my wife?
[Holden] It's a difficult situation. Taking a while to get her here.
translation.ko: 상황이 상황이라 오려면 시간 좀 걸려요

translation.en: -She doesn't want to talk to me? -[Holden] That's not it.
translation.ko: - 나랑 얘기 안 한대? - 그건 아니에요

translation.en: She is very worried about you.
-You talked to her? -[Holden] On the phone.
-Maybe you could talk to her on the phone. -No!
She has to be here.
-[Holden] I understand your frustration. -[Miller] What do you understand?
translation.ko: - 힘든 거 알아요 - 당신이 뭘 알아?

translation.en: [Holden] Not being able to communicate with a trusted loved one.
translation.ko: 사랑하고 믿는 사람과 단절된 기분이 어떤 건지

translation.en: What do you want to say to her?
Why would I tell you?
Maybe I can help.
I don't think so.
-Thank you. -You're welcome.
You followed procedure. You did your job. You did everything by the book.
He took hostages. He knew there'd be consequences.
-He thought he was invisible. -You're not his shrink.
translation.ko: - 자기는 눈에 안 보인댔어요 - 자넨 의사가 아냐

translation.en: You're not responsible for diagnosing him. That's not your remit.
These things happen in real time, and we are the last responders.
translation.ko: 이런 실제 상황에서 우리는 마지막 대응자네

translation.en: If an operation's gonna go south, this is not the worst outcome.
translation.ko: 일이 잘못되면 이 정도로 안 끝날 때도 있어

translation.en: Stay focused on what we do.
If I did everything by the book, it begs the question--
This place is pretty much the benchmark for excellence in law enforcement.
translation.ko: 홀든, 여긴 법 집행 기관의 우수성을 판단하는 기준이 되는 곳이네

translation.en: In the rest of the world, hostage negotiation's on its way out.
You think the Israelis bothered to negotiate at Entebbe last year?
You didn't lose one hostage or bystander. That's how we measure success.
translation.ko: 다친 인질도 행인도 없었네 우린 그걸 성공이라고 해

translation.en: And your courses are a big hit in the summer.
translation.ko: 그리고 이번 여름 자네 수업 인기가 좋아

translation.en: I actually think you should be teaching more.
translation.ko: 수업을 늘리는 게 좋을 것 같네만

translation.en: -You're putting me out to pasture. -No.
I'm putting you to work where it really counts.
Despite what happened.
Because of what happened, Holden.
It seasoned you.
Thank you, sir...
but I'd rather not.
Well, this is awkward.
I'd like you to sleep on it over the weekend...
because you start full-time on Monday.
This is how we find ourselves completely out of control.
translation.ko: 이런 경우는 통제가 전혀 불가능해 보이죠

translation.en: The fugitive has already killed a police officer that morning in Austin.
translation.ko: 인질범은 그날 아침에 벌써 경찰을 한 명 죽였어요

translation.en: He's taken two nine-millimeter rounds in the ass,
translation.ko: 9mm 탄 두 발을 엉덩이에 맞은 채

translation.en: grabbed a ten-year-old boy as a hostage,
and he's holed up in a suburban neighborhood
crawling with women and small children.
Now we must focus on one thing:
de-escalation.
San Antonio's chief of police arrives and starts using a bullhorn,
which more than effectively intimidates our hostage-taker.
Coming at anyone with an attitude of "I'm right, you're wrong"
translation.ko: 난 옳고 넌 틀리다는 태도를 가진 사람은

translation.en: assumes that they're of rational mind.
We must establish communication.
Non-threatening communication.
Ascertain demands,
concede nothing, reject nothing, just listen.
Listen to what he has to say.
Try understanding him instead of trying to dominate him.
translation.ko: 굴복시키려 하지 말고 이해하려고 노력해 보세요

translation.en: Look for common ground.
Find commonality.
And if it feels like you're buying time, well... that's because you are.
translation.ko: 시간을 버는 것 같다고요? 네, 그게 맞으니까요

translation.en: But it's the key to making any perp feel heard.
translation.ko: 말을 들어주고 있다는 느낌을 주는 게 핵심입니다

translation.en: [Holden] Our goal is no body bags.
That is the hostage negotiator win-win.
And I'm in my office on Friday for anyone who has questions
translation.ko: 심리 전략 시험에 대해 질문 있는 사람은

translation.en: about the psychological strategies exam.
[man] Wanton, indiscriminate murder.
Seemingly random, serendipitous.
Each one, extremely violent.
No explanation. No apparent reason.
They weren't sexually assaulted,
there was no attempt to relieve them of valuables,
they didn't know their assailant.
Robert Violante and Stacy Moskowitz were making out in their car
translation.ko: 로버트와 스테이시가 차에서 사랑을 나누던 중

translation.en: when David Berkowitz walked up and shot them both point-blank.
translation.ko: 데이비드 버코위츠가 들이닥쳐 근거리에서 둘을 쏩니다

translation.en: Berkowitz killed six people over two summers,
wounding seven more. Why?
Because a dog told him to do it.
Now...
we can say that the guy's crazy, or that he's pretending that he's crazy.
translation.ko: 미친놈이라 할 수도 있고 미친 척한다고 할 수도 있겠죠

translation.en: But if we're looking for a motive we can understand,
translation.ko: 수긍할 만한 범행 동기를 찾다 보면

translation.en: we suddenly find there is none.
It's a void.
It's a black hole.
Forty years ago, your FBI was founded hunting down John Dillinger,
translation.ko: 40년 전 FBI를 있게 한 범죄자 존 딜린저와

translation.en: Baby Face Nelson, Machine Gun Kelly.
translation.ko: 베이비 페이스 넬슨 머신 건 켈리

translation.en: Criminals who thumbed their noses at society,
but were basically in it for personal gain.
Now, we have extreme violence between strangers.
translation.ko: 이제는 모르는 사람 사이에 극한의 폭력이 자행됩니다

translation.en: Where do we go...
when motive becomes elusive?
Excuse me, Professor Rathman?
Holden Ford, Hostage Negotiation.
Peter. Hi.
I listened in on your class earlier. What you were saying about crime today...
translation.ko: 아까 수업을 슬쩍 들었는데 오늘날의 범죄에 대해 하신 말씀이...

translation.en: I don't know, it really resonates.
-Gets attention. -Were you teaching this before Berkowitz?
A version of it. The headlines kind of fell into my lap.
What got you started?
Starkweather. Whitman. Manson, of course.
But Son of Sam kind of epitomizes now.
translation.ko: 이제 샘의 아들이 그 전형이 됐네

translation.en: It's as if... we don't know anymore what moves people to kill one another.
translation.ko: 살인에 이유가 없는 세상이 된 것 같아요

translation.en: Used to be you find a victim with 50 stab wounds,
translation.ko: 전에는 누가 칼에 50번 찔려 죽었다 하면

translation.en: you look for the jilted lover, the ex-business partner.
Now... it could be a random run-in with a disgruntled mailman.
translation.ko: 이제 길 가던 우체부한테 죽을 수도 있어

translation.en: It's a different era. No more "Just the facts, ma'am."
That's television. And reruns.
-Crime has changed. -Right.
Do you... want to grab a beer?
Yeah, okay.
[Rathman] Look at the unprecedented events
that have occurred in the past decade and a half.
translation.ko: 전례 없는 사건들이 얼마나 많이 생겼나

translation.en: A president assassinated.
Fighting an unpopular war that we didn't win.
National Guard killing four college students.
-You can hardly wrap your mind around it. -Watergate.
Our democracy is vanishing into what?
Is that what all this is about?
Just a response to turmoil?
The government used to be, symbolically, a parental institution.
Now? It's a free-for-all.
The world barely makes any sense, so it follows that crime doesn't either.
You and I could theorize all night, but the truth is, I don't fucking know.
translation.ko: 이론 얘기야 밤새 하지 그런데 실상은 나도 몰라

translation.en: -I don't know either. -No one does.
But we're supposed to, right?
Sure, but here's the troubling thing: no one's even asking the questions.
translation.ko: 그렇지, 그런데 문제는 아무도 묻질 않는단 거야

translation.en: We are.
We are.
Next time, let's discuss Lee Harvey Oswald as Oedipus.
translation.ko: 다음엔 리 하비 오즈월드를 오이디푸스 관점에서 얘기하세

translation.en: -Thank you. -Anytime.
-Hey. -Hey.
What are you looking at?
I like your outfit.
What is that, a jumpsuit? What do you call that?
-This? I call it a jumpsuit. -Stylish.
What do you call that? You look like a Mormon.
You look like my dad.
Is he a Mormon?
No, but he looks like one.
So does mine.
He bought me this suit, as a matter of fact.
Did he buy you those nice shiny shoes?
Yes.
I have one brown pair and one black pair.
I've got sneakers, but I had to buy those myself.
What kind of grown-up lets their parents choose their clothes for them?
translation.ko: 무슨 어른이 부모님이 골라준 옷을 입어요?

translation.en: -Are you coming on to me? -How do you like my approach?
translation.ko: 작업 거는 거예요? 이런 작업 괜찮아요?

translation.en: You having a good time?
-I will be. -Huh!
It's my birthday today.
Happy birthday. How old are you?
-Twenty-four. -You don't look old enough to be in here.
-What are you, a narc? -FBI, actually.
Special Agent Holden Ford.
Wow.
-Can you tell? -Everybody can tell.
You got a gun?
I have one, but I'm not gonna show it to you.
Nuts.
I'm a teacher. Right up the road at Quantico.
What do you teach?
Hostage negotiation, such as it is.
-Holy cow. -You really think I look like a narc?
-Are you kidding? -I don't see it.
You stick out like a sore thumb.
Well, I'm not here to... infiltrate the Black Panthers.
Those guys are hardly Black Panthers. They're engineering students.
You should go talk to them.
I'm sure the FBI's in need of some great-looking black dudes.
-You've got the wrong idea about me. -You gonna book me?
translation.ko: - 날 잘못 보셨네 - 나 잡을 거예요?

translation.en: Maybe.
Handcuffs?
I'm here to see this really cool band from Detroit.
translation.ko: 오늘 엄청 멋진 밴드가 디트로이트에서 온대요

translation.en: You ever been to Detroit?
Yes, actually. I was a--
I was a brick agent there for a couple of years.
I can't believe they're here. They used to play PJ's in Corktown.
translation.ko: 그 밴드가 여기 온다니 코크타운에서만 공연했거든요

translation.en: -You know Corktown? -Sure.
-It looked like a furniture store. -They always sold liquor.
translation.ko: - 거긴 가구점 같아요 - 술은 항상 있잖아요

translation.en: The whole furniture thing was just a front that started during Prohibition.
Where are you really from?
[sighs] Everywhere.
But the Midwest, right?
I grew up in the Midwest, but I was born in Brooklyn.
You do not seem like a guy from New York.
You don't seem like a girl from Corktown.
Buy you a drink?
-[Holden] What's your name? -Debbie.
-You want some pot? -Is that a trick question?
Come on.
Are you serious? No, that's completely inappropriate.
Come on, it's my birthday.
Oh, Jesus, you're not gonna drink and drive, are you?
You've been plying me with booze.
Don't you think that's kind of a mixed message?
You coming?
So what does a brick agent get up to in Detroit?
Mostly corralling Army deserters.
Guys AWOL from Vietnam trying to get to Canada.
Too scared to go back.
Young guys. Same age I was.
So you were a snitch?
There's worse things than being a snitch.
Maybe this'll loosen you up.
God, you are making me nervous.
You are such a goody-goody.
What are you, some kind of honey trap?
I've been warned to watch out for women like you.
You mean normal ones?
So just put your mouth over the hole...
-And inhale. -[bubbling]
[man] I don't want to talk to somebody trying to calm me.
translation.ko: "위험 사격장 출입 금지" 진정하라는 놈하고 얘기하기 싫어

translation.en: -Get somebody in charge. -I am in charge!
I don't want to talk to some flunky pig trying to calm me. What's he doing?
translation.ko: 진정하라는 돼지 새끼랑 말하기 싫어, 저건 뭐야?

translation.en: -Will you get back over there? -What are they there for?
translation.ko: - 나오지 좀 마요! - 저 인간들 뭐냐고!

translation.en: Will you get the fuck back? Get back there, will ya?
-Look at him! -Get over there!
-Go back there, man! -Get over there, will ya?
He wants to kill me so bad, he can taste it! All right?
Attica! Attica! Attica!
[man] I was so confused, I was doing insane things.
translation.ko: 혼란스러워서 말도 안 되는 짓을 했어요

translation.en: What sort of things, Leon?
After the wedding...
I ran off for ten days to Atlantic City.
Sonny was frantic.
He knew I'd been drinking,
he didn't know where I was, who I was with.
[stuttering] Well, I couldn't explain the things I did.
So I went to a psychiatrist...
who told me...
that I was a woman trapped in a man's body.
translation.ko: 전 남자 몸에 갇힌 여자라고 했어요

translation.en: [Holden] So they were both homosexuals,
but he was married,
and his boyfriend wanted to become a woman, which is confusing.
translation.ko: 애인은 여자가 되려 하고 진짜 헷갈리네

translation.en: -You really gotta get out more, Holden. -It was mixed up.
-You didn't like it? -No, I really liked it.
It was just so... sad.
He was obviously very disturbed, but somehow I liked him.
translation.ko: 아주 불안한 사람이지만 왠지 마음에 들어

translation.en: -Yeah, you have empathy. -Yeah.
Empathy.
I really liked the dialogue. It was just very real.
When I started at the Academy,
they would send women out of the room if there was any of that talk.
translation.ko: 이런 얘기가 나오면 여자는 교실에서 내보냈어

translation.en: They called it "deviant terminology."
We even had a list of words we had to memorize.
Really? Which words?
You know...
fuck, shit, pussy... blow job.
Oh, fuck.
Shit.
Finger my pussy.
Finger my pussy, I'll give you a blow job.
All the bad words used in a sentence.
translation.ko: 한 문장에 나쁜 말 다 쓰기

translation.en: [man] It's classic he said-she said.
He says she hit her head on the bedpost having consensual sexual intercourse.
translation.ko: 남자는 합의하의 성관계에서 여자 머리를 침대에 박았다

translation.en: She says he knocked her out
and dragged her into this motel room to rape her.
We know she didn't hit her head on that bedpost because we've measured.
translation.ko: 하지만 조사 결과 머리는 침대 기둥에 박은 게 아니야

translation.en: [Shepard] Where do you propose you would go?
University of Virginia in Charlottesville.
Studying what?
Contemporary Applied Criminal Psychology. Ratchet things up a notch.
translation.ko: 현대적 관점의 응용 범죄 심리요 더 많이 알고 싶어요

translation.en: What exactly is it you think you're missing out on?
We need to know the current academic thinking.
No, you don't want to rely on academics, Holden.
I'm not saying rely, just get updated.
We just got updated.
It's all in the library. 1972, everything was new.
translation.ko: 도서관에 가 봐 72년엔 다 새 거였네

translation.en: That was five years ago.
What's the thinking now?
Okay, look.
There have been some fine psychological studies over the years,
translation.ko: 몇 년간 썩 괜찮은 심리학 연구는 있었지만

translation.en: but these are people who don't understand the criminal mind.
They understand their corner of the world, which is a very small corner.
translation.ko: 우물 안 세상만 보고 연구한 거지 그것도 아주 좁은 우물

translation.en: Well, they must know something.
I'm going to level with you.
I'm going to tell you something I really don't want you to repeat.
translation.ko: 지금 하는 말은 다른 데서 하지 말게

translation.en: As far as the Bureau is concerned, psychology is for backroom boys.
translation.ko: FBI에서는 심리학을 막후 세력들 것으로 생각해

translation.en: -[chime sounds] -You understand what I'm trying to say?
No. What's a "backroom boy"?
It's just frowned upon.
We should be using every resource we can.
Talking to the smartest people we find from the broadest possible spectrum.
translation.ko: 최대한 여러 분야에서 제일 똑똑한 사람들을 만나고

translation.en: -And we do. -Otherwise, it's like the military.
translation.ko: - 그렇게 하고 있잖아 - 아니면 군대랑 똑같아요

translation.en: -Hey, we recruited Elvis. -So did the military.
The King doesn't do it for you?
Hoover died over five years ago,
and we're still recruiting accountants and lawyers like it's 1946.
Actually, recruitment has tapered off.
-We can't get accountants. -Well, then we're in trouble.
[sighs] All right. I'll scratch your back
and recommend funding for you to audit a few classes,
translation.ko: 수업 몇 개 들을 수 있게 해보겠네

translation.en: but you will be expected to use the opportunity for recruitment.
translation.ko: 자네는 그 기회를 이용해 인재들을 끌어와

translation.en: Speakers, lecturers, great minds.
-Are you sure you want me doing that? -You're smart, you're idealistic...
translation.ko: - 저한테 그걸 하라고요? - 자넨 똑똑한 이상가야

translation.en: more than a little sensitive.
They're gonna love you.
-Hare Krishna. -Hare Krishna.
-Hare Krishna. -[man] And then, in 1872,
Italian physician Cesare Lombroso drags us out of the Dark Ages
translation.ko: 이탈리아의 체사레 롬브로소가 암흑시대에서 우릴 끌어내어

translation.en: and launches the scientific era in criminology
by differentiating five criminal classes:
the born criminal,
insane criminal,
criminal by passion,
habitual criminal,
and the occasional criminal.
In other words, there are those that are born that way
and those who become that way.
And in 1965, there's this other breakthrough.
This criminal psychology research project
at Bellevue psychiatric hospital in New York couched it like this:
translation.ko: 범죄 심리 조사 프로젝트는 이렇게 분류했습니다

translation.en: personality and character
far outweigh the presence of psychotic or defective diagnoses.
translation.ko: 정신증이나 결함에 대한 진단을 훨씬 넘어선 것이죠

translation.en: In other words, by extrapolation...
are criminals born...
or are they formed?
Do you mind if I sit?
You're sitting.
You know, I wasn't aware of that project at Bellevue.
Well, you should be.
Where I come from, criminals are always born that way.
translation.ko: 제가 있는 데선 항상 범죄자는 타고난다고 해요

translation.en: Some people will never stop believing that.
translation.ko: 그 믿음을 놓지 않는 사람들이 있죠

translation.en: -It's too easy. -It lets us off the hook.
Well, essentially we're a puritan nation.
We blame all our problems on a minority of bad apples.
translation.ko: 소수의 썩은 사과들에게 문제를 전부 떠넘기죠

translation.en: What's your name again? I'm sorry. Is it Leon?
Buchanan. [scoffs]
Leo.
Holden.
-Holden Ford. -I know who you are.
Everybody does.
Yeah.
I've noticed some of the looks I've been getting.
Funny looks isn't a federal offense... yet.
translation.ko: 못생긴 게 연방 범죄는 아니죠 아직은

translation.en: Yeah, they're just curious.
Well, I'm not a spy.
This isn't some kind of cover.
Good. Because that... would have been a really pathetic cover.
I'm actually an instructor too, but I'm just here to learn.
translation.ko: 사실 저도 강사인데 배우러 온 거예요

translation.en: And I'm here to talk to people like you.
What do you want to talk about?
I want to start a dialogue with you.
Would be that okay?
A dialogue about what?
I'm an instructor in the Bureau's training and recruitment program out of Quantico.
translation.ko: 전 FBI의 훈련과 채용 프로그램을 맡고 있는데

translation.en: And we really need to hear from people like you.
translation.ko: 선생님 같은 분의 의견을 진심으로 듣고 싶어요

translation.en: I'm sorry, are you trying to recruit me?
Just to hear your perspectives and your insights.
[laughs] I understand...
perfectly.
I'm sorry. You call yourself a professor of criminal psychology.
But you won't even talk to the educational arm of the FBI?
translation.ko: FBI의 교육 부서엔 눈길도 안 주겠다고요?

translation.en: It's just...
a sign of the times, man.
-[Debbie] Lost your appetite? -[Holden] Do these fucking hippies
translation.ko: - 입맛 없어? - 이 처량한 히피 놈들은

translation.en: seriously believe that they're worthy of an enormously costly, labor-intensive
translation.ko: 진짜 자기들이 연방 감시를 받을 주제가 된다 생각해?

translation.en: federal surveillance operation?
It sounds like the contempt is mutual.
Don't you think that the traditional counterculture-law enforcement enmity
translation.ko: 반문화와 법 집행 기관 사이의 케케묵은 증오심도

translation.en: is a little old hat by now?
They'll never forgive you for putting a tail on John and Yoko.
translation.ko: 존과 요코를 미행한 건 절대 용서 안 할걸

translation.en: Frankly, I'm surprised to have aroused such a degree of fucking neuroses
translation.ko: 솔직히 배웠다는 사람들한테 그 정도의 노이로제 반응을

translation.en: amongst supposedly intelligent people.
Please, they're flattering themselves.
[whispers] They think you're wearing a wire.
There. You're one of us now.
Okay, everything's all right. Come on. Right. Yeah. Okay.
-Come on out, Sonny. -They're too close!
Come on, get back! What the fuck are you doing? Get back!
Get them back.
-Get back, okay? -Come here.
Come on out.
Now take a look at this. Come on.
Hey, look. Look up here. Look.
Look.
Look over here. Huh?
Over there. Look. You got everything here, okay?
Okay. So what are they doing wrong?
-They're making him mad. -They're making him scared.
translation.ko: - 화를 돋우고 있어요 - 겁을 주고 있죠

translation.en: -So? -We do not want him scared.
We want him calm.
Let me call and see what they say. I'll talk to them and ask, all right?
Then we'll see. Anything else I can give you?
translation.ko: 그다음에 얘기하지 또 원하는 건 없어?

translation.en: Yeah, I want you to bring my wife down here.
Okay, what do you give us?
What do you want?
The guy is robbing a bank to pay for a sex change for his boyfriend.
translation.ko: 남자친구 성전환 비용을 위해 은행을 턴 남자는

translation.en: He wants a helicopter with a piano.
But more than anything, he wants to talk to his wife.
-Complicated, right? -[man] Yeah.
[Holden] Trust me on this.
Always expect complicated.
Okay, I need you to concentrate.
Think of an opening salvo, then think where it could lead.
No right or wrong answers,
just use your imagination and see where it takes you.
Start whenever you like. Go ahead.
All right. I'm asking you to put the gun down, Mike.
No way. Kiss my black ass, Mark.
Wait, what?
For the purpose of this exercise, I'm imagining I'm Negro.
That's good. That's fine. Keep it going. Just whatever comes into your head.
[Mark] Okay.
Then fuck you! I asked you to put that gun down.
No, fuck you, you dumb cracker motherfucker.
Wait, wait a minute. What is all that?
It's jive talk.
We don't need to get into that. Forget vernacular.
In real life, people just press their demands.
All right?
Um... [clears throat]
Uh... put the gun down, Steve.
We brought your children to see you.
You what?
Oh, my God. I lost custody. I haven't seen my children in years.
translation.ko: 맙소사, 양육권 뺏겨서 못 본 지 몇 년 됐는데

translation.en: [Holden] Okay, good.
Important not to talk to a divorced man about his children. Different tactic.
translation.ko: 이혼한 남자에게 자식 얘기는 안 하는 게 좋겠죠, 다시

translation.en: All right, I asked nicely. Now put the fucking gun down.
-Why don't you make me, faggot? -[Mark] What?!
I'm no faggot, motherfucker!
Okay, let's dial it back a little.
Excuse me. What is the point of this?
[Holden] Great question.
Psychologically preparing you for reality.
And the reality is, you have to talk to them.
Somebody demands the impossible, you can't just shoot him.
translation.ko: 불가능한 요구를 한다고 쏴버릴 순 없습니다

translation.en: Then why have so much firearms training?
Well, because that is a tactical response for when all else fails.
translation.ko: 모든 수단이 실패한 경우 필요한 전술적 조치니까요

translation.en: But if local law enforcement can't shut something down,
translation.ko: 지역 경찰 등이 문제 해결에 실패했다면

translation.en: then it has required a tactical response.
Okay, but wouldn't you like to try something different?
Or would you rather use firearms all the time?
-I'd kind of rather use firearms. -Why?
Seems safer?
Holden, I enjoyed that immensely. What do you call that?
translation.ko: 홀든, 재밌게 잘 봤네 뭘 한 건가?

translation.en: It's just role-playing in a simulated hostage situation.
translation.ko: 모의 인질 상황을 놓고 역할극을 한 겁니다

translation.en: -Stimulated? -Simulated.
All that profanity, is that an academic thing?
They're improvising. They're learning to create a dialogue.
How is all that cursing creating a dialogue?
It's not really about the cursing.
I'm sure it's all quite modern and fashionable in academic circles,
but it seems very theatrical to me.
Well, in criminal psych, role-playing exercises
are considered a valuable tool, with or without the cursing.
translation.ko: 아주 좋은 방식입니다 욕을 쓰든 안 쓰든

translation.en: I think we have enough exercises here at the Academy.
If you're going to start implementing new ones,
talk to somebody in the Behavioral Science Unit.
They can help?
They can go over the soundness of the psychology. That's their thing.
Okay, good idea.
-Why don't I set that up? -Okay.
Thank you, yes.
Holden, right? Holden Ford?
Hi.
Bill Tench. Behavioral Science.
Oh, great to meet you.
-You had a beer with Peter Rathman? -Interesting guy.
I was kind of disturbed by what he said.
You were, huh?
-Can we sit? -Yes. Please.
-Smoke? -Oh, uh...
I don't smoke when I eat.
Want to go outside?
I don't smoke when I don't eat either.
translation.ko: 밥 안 먹을 때도 안 피워서요

translation.en: So did Shepard talk to you about my thing?
He did his best.
What does that mean?
-He can be pretty old school. -[scoffs]
I call this place "the country club," because, you know,
it can be a little starchy sometimes.
I hear that.
You went back to college, right?
UVA.
How old are you, 26, 27?
Twenty-nine.
That's interesting.
Lot of guys your age don't want to go back to school because they feel it undermines their authority.
translation.ko: 그 나이엔 체면 안 선다고 학교 가기 싫어하는데

translation.en: I was hoping it would give me some authority.
He's got you doing recruitment, right?
Yeah, well, I'm there, so I might as well make myself useful.
translation.ko: 네, 학교도 갔으니 저도 도움은 드려야죠

translation.en: Most guys don't want to get stuck doing recruitment.
translation.ko: 대부분 그런 일은 잘 안 하려고 해

translation.en: They're busy working their way upwards.
I guess I'm busy working my way sideways.
You are what they call a "blue flamer." You know what that is?
No. What does that mean?
You're so eager to do good,
you have a big, blue flame shooting out of your asshole.
Oh... is that bad?
Just take it slow. You'll get there in the end.
translation.ko: 천천히 해 될 건 다 되게 돼 있어

translation.en: I'm just trying to be a better instructor.
translation.ko: 그냥 더 좋은 강사가 되려는 것뿐이에요

translation.en: Right. Well, I was thinking about that.
I started this thing a couple of years ago.
I go on the road and give classes in various police departments
from Buffalo, New York to San Diego, California.
There's a million cops out there who want to know what we know.
translation.ko: 우리 지식을 원하는 경찰이 깔리고 깔렸어

translation.en: So I go to them, give them a distillation of what we teach here,
and they tell me what they've been doing.
They learn something,
and I learn something firsthand by getting involved on their level.
translation.ko: 직접 만나 눈높이를 맞추면서 나도 배우는 게 있어

translation.en: But it's a big job, you know?
I'm up to my neck in local law enforcement.
translation.ko: 난 그쪽 일에 완전히 몰두하고 있지

translation.en: Would you want some help with that?
Maybe we could help each other.
What?
Nothing.
Don't be shy.
Did you orgasm?
Did I orgasm?
What?
-I can't believe you're from New York. -You could be faking, right?
translation.ko: 이런 사람이 뉴욕 출신이라니 연기할 수도 있잖아

translation.en: You can't tell if a woman is faking?
I can't even tell if a woman is interested.
translation.ko: 나한테 관심 있는 여자도 못 알아봐

translation.en: But you can tell if somebody's lying, like a suspect.
That is not the same thing.
-Pretend I'm a suspect. -[scoffs]
Use your powers of deduction, Agent Ford.
How can you figure out the criminal mind if you can't figure out your girlfriend?
translation.ko: 여자친구 마음도 모르는데 범죄자 속은 어떻게 알아?

translation.en: Are you my girlfriend?
Wait. Is this another of those things you just can't tell?
translation.ko: 뭐야, 설마 그것도 구분 못 해?

translation.en: I don't know. Are you?
What do you need, an exchange of rings over milkshakes?
I just didn't want to presume anything.
Really, Holden, sometimes you're like a monk.
translation.ko: 어떨 때 보면 무슨 스님 같아

translation.en: Surely people in law enforcement shouldn't be so naive.
translation.ko: 이런 일 하는 사람들은 순진하면 안 되지 않나?

translation.en: Does it make you uncomfortable...
sleeping with a federal agent?
Where did that come from?
Does it turn you on?
Not at all.
Then why are you with me?
You're smart.
You're nice.
What? Those are good things.
And you're devastating.
Well, thank you.
Oh, come on, you're not leaving.
I have to get up early.
Tomorrow's the first day of school.
[man on radio] Ninety-nine plus KFMH, Muscatine, Davenport in Iowa Central...
♪ Hold the line ♪
[Tench] Today might be a baptism of fire. They're gonna be on edge.
translation.ko: 첫날부터 쉽지 않을 거야 지금 다들 까칠하거든

translation.en: -Just follow my lead. -What happened?
translation.ko: - 나만 잘 따라와 - 무슨 일 있어요?

translation.en: They caught a big case and they're spooked.
Don't talk to any reporters.
And please, for God's sake, don't say we're from the FBI.
translation.ko: 그리고 절대로 FBI란 말 하지 말고

translation.en: Excuse me, gentlemen. I'm from the Fairfield Chronicle.
You gentlemen are from the FBI, is that right?
How are things with the Jeffries case?
No idea what you're talking about.
The Jeffries case. Ada Jeffries.
-You can come back for the rest. -The woman found behind the church.
translation.ko: - 이건 나중에 챙겨 - 교회 뒤에서 발견된 여자요

translation.en: -We're here for something else. -The woman and her little boy.
translation.ko: - 우린 다른 일로 왔어요 - 아들도 죽었잖아요

translation.en: We're instructors.
Are you from the Methodist church?
Do we look like we're from the Methodist church?
Yes.
Make a hole.
Good to see ya.
[Tench] Motive, means, opportunity.
The three pillars of criminal investigation for the last century.
translation.ko: 지난 100년간 범죄 수사의 핵심 세 가지죠

translation.en: But it's 1977, and suddenly motive is elusive.
What, why, who.
"What happened?" "Why did it happen that way?"
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 생겼는가 왜 그런 식이 됐는가

translation.en: Which should lead to: "Who did it?"
A person is murdered. Not sexually assaulted, not robbed.
translation.ko: 사람이 살해됐어요 성폭행도 없었고 강도도 아닙니다

translation.en: But the body is mutilated posthumously.
The question is not only why did the killer do it,
but why did the killer do it this way?
translation.ko: 왜 하필 그런 식으로 했는지가 중요합니다

translation.en: We are now talking about... psychology.
[clears throat] When I'm involved in a hostage negotiation,
the perpetrator is standing right in front of me,
but I have to gauge how much destruction he's capable of,
translation.ko: 범인이 무슨 짓까지 저지를 수 있는지

translation.en: what in his background or personal life that could've triggered today's standoff.
translation.ko: 어떤 환경이 이런 상황을 유발했는지 알아내야 합니다

translation.en: Some people are just crazy, right?
Crazy in that they have no reason for what they do?
translation.ko: 미쳤으면 이유도 없이 그런 짓을 할까요?

translation.en: -Yeah. -[Holden] Okay.
But keep in mind, often, this crazy person has never done anything like this before.
translation.ko: 하지만 보통은 미친 사람도 그런 일은 처음입니다

translation.en: Something just... flips.
-Like a switch. -Good, a switch.
Anybody know what flips it?
-Getting fired? -Fired. Yes.
-Getting dumped. -[Holden] Absolutely.
A romantic breakup is a top trigger.
When we know who the criminal is, we can understand what set him off.
translation.ko: 범죄자에 대해 알면 범행 동기를 이해할 수 있어요

translation.en: In a homicide situation, we do the inverse.
We ask, "What happened? Why did it happen that way?"
translation.ko: 먼저 무슨 일이 생겼는가 왜 이렇게 됐는가를 묻고

translation.en: Which narrows the search for who did it.
translation.ko: 점점 범위를 좁혀 누가 했는지를 찾죠

translation.en: But what if our killer is someone who's not rational?
Why do we behave the way we do?
It's a question asked by poets, and philosophers, and theologians
translation.ko: 시인, 철학자, 신학자들이 끝없이 물었던 질문입니다

translation.en: since time immemorial.
The playground of Shakespeare, Dostoyevsky, Freud.
The stuff of Crime and Punishment and Beyond the Pleasure Principal.
The greatest minds in history have been fascinated by the vagaries of behavior.
translation.ko: 역사의 위대한 사상가들은 예상치 못한 행동에 매료됐어요

translation.en: So, in a case where we can't immediately divine a motive, we shouldn't panic.
translation.ko: 범행 동기가 분명하지 않더라도 당황해선 안 돼요

translation.en: It's a riddle, but it can be solved.
It's complex, but... it's human.
-[quiet muttering] -Thank you, Holden.
That was very... illuminating.
So what the hell's Beyond the Pleasure Principle?
-By Freud? -[man] So this is about sex?
Actually, it's where he looks for human impulses beyond sex,
translation.ko: 성적 쾌락을 넘어서는 충동에 관한 내용이에요

translation.en: -specifically the death drive. -[man 2] What's that?
translation.ko: - 특히 죽음의 충동에 관한 - 그게 뭔데요?

translation.en: -Something my kid does with a stick shift. -[laughter]
translation.ko: 애가 운전대 잡는 게 죽음의 충동이지 프로이트는 파멸의 충동이 있다고 생각했어요

translation.en: Freud suggests that there's an innate desire for destruction,
based on the propensity for matter to return--
-What does this have to do with motive? -[Holden] Well...
we've always looked at motive as need or greed, right?
translation.ko: 우리가 아는 범행 동기는 늘 빈곤이나 탐욕입니다

translation.en: -Guy steals a TV to sell it to buy drugs. -[Holden] Exactly.
translation.ko: - TV 훔쳐 팔아 약 사니까 - 맞아요

translation.en: But let's say, while he's at it, he steals your wife's panties, too.
translation.ko: 그런데 여러분 부인의 속옷도 함께 훔친다면요?

translation.en: If he stole my wife's panties, I'd be amazed.
translation.ko: 내 마누라 속옷엔 손도 안 댈 텐데

translation.en: -[laughter] -[Holden] Well, he's not selling those.
translation.ko: 팔 게 아니라면 왜 그런 짓을 할까요?

translation.en: So why does he do it? Is it merely prurient?
translation.ko: 팔 게 아니라면 왜 그런 짓을 할까요? 단순한 욕정 때문에?

translation.en: He could be motivated by something he doesn't even understand.
translation.ko: 동기가 뭔지 본인도 모를 수 있어요

translation.en: Our new quest, like Freud,
is to look beyond what we assume are obvious impulses.
translation.ko: 눈에 보이는 충동 너머를 보는 것입니다

translation.en: So why didn't you just say that?
[Holden]They don't want to learn. What are we even doing here?
translation.ko: 배울 마음이 없잖아요 우린 여기서 뭐 하는 거예요?

translation.en: [Tench] Don't make it too complicated.
What's wrong with complicated?
There's complicated and there's too complicated, Holden.
translation.ko: 어려운 게 있고 너무 어려운 게 있어

translation.en: We used to do this experiment in social psychology.
Uh-huh. What was that?
You get onto a crowded elevator, and you face the opposite direction,
translation.ko: 만원 엘리베이터에 타서 반대 방향을 보는 거예요

translation.en: the back of the elevator, and everybody freaks out.
translation.ko: 엘리베이터 뒤쪽을요 그럼 다들 막 당황해요

translation.en: They're uncomfortable for reasons they can't even articulate.
translation.ko: 이유를 설명할 순 없는데 불편한 거죠

translation.en: But if you turn around and face the front, everybody relaxes.
translation.ko: 하지만 다시 돌아 앞을 보면 모두가 안심해요

translation.en: Okay. Well, how do we do that?
What do we have in common?
What unites us?
What keeps us all awake at night?
translation.ko: 우리를 잠 못 들게 하는 게 뭐죠?

translation.en: -[all groaning] -Monster. Right?
I think we can all agree.
But what do you really know about him?
Did you know that his mother was a jailbird and a prostitute?
Did you know when he was ten years old,
she palmed him off onto his sadistic, Bible-thumping uncle
who beat him within an inch of his life and taunted him to act like a man?
translation.ko: 외삼촌이 맨슨을 구타하고 남자답지 못하다며 조롱한 건?

translation.en: Charles responded to that by becoming a pimp
translation.ko: 그에 대한 응답으로 찰스는 포주가 되었고

translation.en: and an armed robber, and was incarcerated for over 20 years,
translation.ko: 무장 강도가 됐으며 20년 넘게 수감 생활을 하며

translation.en: where he continued to be brutalized.
In 1967, he was paroled, during the Summer of Love.
And our nightmare began.
-[man] Jesus! -[man 2] Come on!
Here we have a child who was unwanted, unloved, regularly beaten,
translation.ko: 축복과 사랑 없이 구타만 당하던 소년은

translation.en: and repeatedly institutionalized.
Now, might this not have had some sort of an effect on him?
-He was born that way. -What way?
-[man] Just bad. -Can we be a little bit more specific?
-Technically, he didn't kill anybody. -[murmuring]
translation.ko: 따지고 보면 찰스는 아무도 죽이지 않았어요

translation.en: Look at those eyes. How can you not say that dude's evil?
translation.ko: 저 눈을 보세요 저게 악하지 않다고요?

translation.en: That's a little bit Old Testament, don't you think?
translation.ko: 그건 좀 구약성서 같은 얘기 아닌가요?

translation.en: Good, evil, black, white, it's easy.
translation.ko: 선함, 악함, 흑, 백 이런 건 쉽죠

translation.en: But who in this room has a life that's easy?
translation.ko: 하지만 삶이 쉬운 사람이 어디 있을까요?

translation.en: Circumstances affect behavior.
When we look at Manson's background,
the real question is, how could we not have seen this coming?
translation.ko: 이런 결과를 예측 못 한 게 놀라울 따름이죠

translation.en: We did.
[Holden] I'm sorry?
He was institutionalized because we could see it coming.
translation.ko: 그리될 줄 알았으니 교정 시설에 보낸 거지

translation.en: Okay, but I'm saying maybe, just maybe,
locking him up his young life helped make him what he was.
translation.ko: 어린 시절의 감옥 생활이 범죄를 더 부추겼다면?

translation.en: -[man] No. -What the fuck?
They locked him up because of what he did.
They already knew what he was.
Okay, guys, I'm not asking anybody to feel sorry for Charles Manson.
translation.ko: 찰스 맨슨에게 동정심을 느끼라는 게 아니에요

translation.en: If he were here, I'd shoot him dead. No one would stop me.
translation.ko: 놈이 이 자리에 있으면 난 쏴 죽일 겁니다

translation.en: [man] Right.
What Holden's trying to say is maybe it's both.
translation.ko: 그러니까 둘 다 원인일 수 있다는 말이에요

translation.en: The one impacting on the other in a vicious circle.
translation.ko: 서로 영향을 주는 악순환의 고리란 거죠

translation.en: Nobody has all the answers.
translation.ko: 답을 모두 아는 사람은 아무도 없습니다

translation.en: -We have some answers. -We should be asking questions.
translation.ko: - 어느 정도는 알죠 - 질문을 던져야 합니다

translation.en: [man] No shit.
Well, I'll just tell my buddies in Robbery-Homicide
who were there when the corpses were found,
translation.ko: 시체 발견됐을 때 현장에 있던 친구들한테

translation.en: that they may have overlooked a difficult upbringing.
translation.ko: 불우한 어린 시절을 간과한 거 아니냐고

translation.en: You were LAPD?
Twenty-two years.
You worked Manson?
No, but I knew every single man who did.
How many homicides have you worked?
translation.ko: 자네는 살인 사건 몇 건이나 해봤나?

translation.en: Figure out who you're talking to before you tell a sob story
translation.ko: 처키 맨슨의 불우한 가정사를 들먹일 거면

translation.en: about little Chuckie Manson.
They wrote "pigs" on the wall in their victims' blood.
They completely missed my point.
In the future, ask if anyone's worked a case before you bring it up.
translation.ko: 다음엔 말 꺼내기 전에 담당자 있는지부터 물어

translation.en: -Know your fucking audience. -Oh, shit.
It's okay, they always do this.
Just be a good listener.
Gentlemen.
Frank McGraw.
I didn't mean to embarrass anybody back there.
translation.ko: 아까는 일부러 난처하게 한 건 아니네

translation.en: Not a problem.
We're all a little tense around here.
You must have heard about the mother and child who were murdered recently.
translation.ko: 최근 살해당한 모자 얘기 들었을 텐데

translation.en: -Ada Jeffries and her boy. -We've seen reporters.
She was bound,
stabbed repeatedly about the chest and face.
The boy's throat was cut.
[groans] Rough one.
I don't understand entirely what you're talking about with psychology.
I don't understand much of anything anymore.
What's on your mind, Frank?
-I hate to bother. -No, by all means. Bother us.
When I left Los Angeles, I thought I'd gone far enough.
translation.ko: LA를 떠나면서 겪을 만큼 겪었다 싶었는데

translation.en: Ada was the kind of woman who wouldn't say boo to a goose.
translation.ko: 에이다는 거위 하나도 못 쫓는 여자였네

translation.en: She came from a deeply religious family in Arkansas.
When they found out she was pregnant, they put her out.
She lived in a rooming house in Libertyville.
No drugs, no alcohol, never had a brush with the law.
translation.ko: 마약도, 술도 안 했고 법을 어긴 적도 없었네

translation.en: The boy was polite and quiet.
She had him in Sunday school at the Methodist church.
She would sweep the steps every evening,
translation.ko: 에이다는 매일 저녁 교회 계단을 쓸었어

translation.en: just to be of service.
I never met Ada.
Every now and again,
I'd see her and her son walk along the road into town.
translation.ko: 아들과 함께 동네로 걸어가는 걸 봤네

translation.en: They didn't have a car.
Landlady found the bodies.
They had been dead...
four days.
What people won't do to each other.
Nothing people won't do.
How can we help?
[McGraw] She was found cuffed and lashed to the bed.
A broomstick perforated her rectum.
Whoever it was made the boy watch,
then did the same thing to him.
How'd he get in?
Bathroom window. We think that's how he came and went.
There was no sign of forcible entry.
-No one heard a peep. -In a rooming house?
My assumption is, he held a knife to the boy to keep her quiet,
translation.ko: 아들을 칼로 위협해 에이다를 조용히 시키고

translation.en: and vice versa.
This falls clearly into the category of lust murder.
translation.ko: 쾌락 살인의 범주에 정확히 들어가긴 합니다

translation.en: By that I mean it's sexually motivated.
That cannot be about horny.
It's more about sexual gratification through the annihilation of another.
translation.ko: 사람을 해치면서 성적 희열을 느끼는 거죠

translation.en: -Did you find semen? -Found some on a throw cushion.
It was blood type O. I know that's not much help.
-[Tench] In the victims? -[McGraw] No.
-He didn't rape them. -He could have problems with sex.
translation.ko: - 강간은 안 했네 - 성적 불능자일 수도 있어요

translation.en: That'd be a good bet.
Could narrow things with your suspects.
I don't have suspects.
I don't have fingerprints, shoe prints,
not so much as a single hair.
Well...
The fact that the killer left nothing behind is interesting.
It must have been premeditated to a degree.
He had gloves, he cleaned up after himself.
You think he was stalking her?
-Or she just caught his eye. -What about the boy?
He was a witness.
There are more expedient ways to get rid of a witness.
-Why make the boy watch? -And why sodomize him?
translation.ko: - 왜 보게 했을까요? - 왜 빗자루를 꽂았을까?

translation.en: [Holden] That's a good point.
Is this crime about the woman or about the child?
-You're asking me? -I was just posing questions.
translation.ko: - 나한테 묻는 건가? - 질문을 던지는 거예요

translation.en: I get that.
-The broomstick. -Yeah?
Is it the same broomstick she used to sweep the church steps?
-What if it is? -He might not be a congregant,
maybe someone just passing through, but the church could be significant.
translation.ko: 행인일 수도 있지만 교회가 중요할 수도 있어요

translation.en: Could be?
[Holden] With the idea of service.
I think that there's a passage in Mark.
translation.ko: 마가복음에 그런 구절이 있는 것 같은데

translation.en: Something about the "Son of Man."
I don't follow.
[Holden] All I'm saying is, the broom may mean something.
What?
I don't know.
It's hard to tell from just the photos.
This woman was devoted to her child, tried hard,
and some stranger came along and...
Come on, Agent Ford, you got fancy methods.
translation.ko: 이봐, 포드 요원 자넨 기술 좋잖아

translation.en: What does a broomstick in the ass of a dirt poor single mom mean?
translation.ko: 찢어지게 가난한 싱글맘한테 빗자루를 꽂은 이유가 뭐겠냐고

translation.en: I don't know.
You're kidding me.
I don't understand it.
-We can't help you with this. -We need more time to go over this.
translation.ko: - 저흰 도움 안 되겠네요 - 알아볼 시간이 더 필요해요

translation.en: We are in the dark here. We don't know any more than you do.
translation.ko: 우리는 아는 게 없어요 형사님도 마찬가지고

translation.en: How fucking dare you?
I'm sorry we wasted your time.
-Can I get these back to you? -[scoffs]
-In the dark, huh? -We are.
I have studied everything we have. I've taken this ride here,
translation.ko: 검토할 건 다 검토했어요 여기까지 차 타고 와서

translation.en: listened to everything you've been kind enough to teach,
but we're talking about something we don't understand in the slightest.
translation.ko: 하지만 이건 전혀 이해가 안 돼요

translation.en: I was trying to help you.
If you don't like it, go back to your college kids
and we'll forget about it.
Ada and her son were killed
for reasons we are simply not equipped to understand.
It wasn't lust murder.
It wasn't some random thrill killer who was born bad,
and it wasn't a pantie thief who wanted to change things up.
translation.ko: 속옷 도둑이 판 키운 것도 아니에요

translation.en: It was an aberration.
Let me tell you something about aberrant behavior.
translation.ko: 일탈 행위에 대해 하나 말해줄까, 홀든?

translation.en: It's fucking aberrant.
If we understood it, we'd be aberrant too.
Fortunately, it's not incumbent upon us to write a dissertation.
translation.ko: 다행히 그걸로 논문 쓸 일도 없어

translation.en: -Well, maybe we should. -Why?
Our job is to give him something he could not have figured out himself.
translation.ko: 혼자선 알아내지 못할 뭔가를 알려주는 게 우리 일이니까

translation.en: -I am sticking my neck out for you. -No disrespect.
translation.ko: - 난 너 때문에 하는 일이야 - 그건 감사한데

translation.en: At the moment, I don't think we can say anything to McGraw with any certainty.
translation.ko: 지금은 맥그로에게 확실히 말할 수 있는 게 없어요

translation.en: Let me ask you something. Where are you from?
I was born in New York, but it's kind of a mixed bag.
Okay. Well, that's what you are right now, a mixed bag.
translation.ko: 그래, 그게 지금 딱 너야 이것저것 섞인 거

translation.en: A little college education, some experience on the street,
translation.ko: 대학 교육 조금 실전 경험 조금

translation.en: some insight, a lot of horseshit.
I agree with you.
It's been one step forward, two steps back.
Let me ask you something else. Do you have a girlfriend?
-I do now, Bill, as it happens. -Okay.
So next time you're a long way from home and you flip your shit,
you find a pay phone and you tell it to your girlfriend.
-Okay? -Okay.
-How's that sound? -It sounds okay, Bill.
♪ Crying ♪
